Title:
Dolichospora sycopsis-sinensis gen. et sp. nov., a new rust
fungus on Sycopsis sinensis from China
Keywords:
New rust disease, Pucciniaceae, Phylogeny, Sycopsis,
Taxonomy
Abstract:
A new genus and species, Dolichospora sycopsis-sinensis
which found on Sycopsis sinensis and it is the first rust fungus
reported on the host of genus Sycopsis. It is similar to twelve genera,
Alveolaria, Ceratocoma, Chardoniella, Cionothrix, Cronartium,
Crossopsora, Didymopsora, Dietelia, Endophyllum, Pucciniosira, Skierka
and Trichopsora in columnar telia, but can be distinguished by other
characters of telia stage. The new fungus is characterised by telia with
cylindrical peridium, subepidermailn origin, spores becoming erumpent as
gelatinous hair-like columns, teliospores catenulate one-celled, mature
spores of a single chain separated by pedicel-like cells, and basidia
external. Phylogenetic analyses of large nuclear subunit ribosomal DNA
with a wide selection of Cronartiaceae, Phakopsoraceae, Pileolariaceae
Pucciniaceae and Pucciniosiraceae rust families which having columnar
telia taxa showed that the new genus and species is sister to the genera
Stereostratum but differ in one-celled teliospores with intercalary
cells.
